Posts.Content: On Aug 06, 2013 1:29 AM Dlynn1210 wrote: My 44 year old daughter has had two lumps in her breast for a couple of years.  Routine mamograms showed no malignancy.  A couple of months ago, she discovered a third lump and went in for a routine mamogram.  The report came back saying there had been no change in the two lumps and considered stable.  We both asked how there could be no change when she could no palpate a third lump.  She has been experiencing intense fatigue and pain - which is so unlike my "tough" daughter who has been through a lot without complaint.  About a month ago, she noticed purple veins running through on breast down to the nipple.  This morning she woke up with dimples in one breast surrounded by red skin that was hot to the touch.  She also has discovered a lump in her pelvic area.  The doctor she was seeing in her small town believed it was all hormonal and didn't believe it necessary to send her on for an MRI.  Has anyone had these symptoms - veins running through the breast, dimpling, redness, and heat in one breast.  A friend who has been battling breast cancer for six years told me that fever in the breast was one symptom she had just prior to her diagnosis.  I am trying to get my daughter to see a specialist but she has an appointment with a clinic on Wed hoping to get an order for an MRI so her insurance covers it. Diana    any development on your daughter?
Posts.Title: New Developments in Breast
